title.narrative: SWE-2012-127: Efficient use of land and energy in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania - Urban planning and climate adaptation
SWE-2012-127: Efficient use of land and energy in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania - Urban planning and climate adaptation

description.narrative: The aim of this project is to propose urban planning principles leading to efficient use of energy and land in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. It is believed that a climate-sensitive planning can minimize negative consequences of urbanization and climate change and enhance the possibilities to use solar energy. This project will investigate the consequences of current urban regulations on land use, energy use, microclimate and solar access and suggest how these regulations could be modified. The methods include interviews, microclimate measurements, simulations of microclimate and solar energy potential. The project is expected to lead to increased local knowledge and to higher building densities and increased solar potential in Dar es Salaam in the future. This will benefit the urban poor through improved microclimate, cheaper infrastructure and transports and better access to electricity.
